course_catalog.title: Introduction to Accounting
topics: Financial Accounting: objectives/importance, accounting as information system, computerized applications, double entry, accounts & classification, accounting equation, cycle, journal/ledger/trial balance, financial statements, concepts & conventions

Cost & Management Accounting: cost concepts/classification, overheads & recovery, job order costing, job cost sheet & quotation price, inventory valuation, absorption vs marginal costing, CVP analysis, contribution-margin, sensitivity analysis
Investment decisions: short-term (relevant/differential costs), long-term (capital budgeting, evaluation techniques)

course_catalog.title: Computer Fundamentals
topics: Processors, binary arithmetic, floating point representation
Software types, logic circuits, computer architecture

course_catalog.title: Programming Language I
topics: C fundamentals, data types, operators, expressions
Pointers and pointer arithmetic; arrays & pointers; pointer-to-pointer

course_catalog.title: Discrete Mathematics
topics: Sets, functions, growth of functions, algorithm complexity
Discrete probability, recurrence relations, generating functions

course_catalog.title: Data Structures
topics: Elementary data types, structures, arrays, pointers
Graph representation and basic graph algorithms

course_catalog.title: Numerical Methods
topics: Numeric representation, floating-point arithmetic, precision error

course_catalog.title: Programming Language II (OOP in Java and C++)
Programming Language II Lab (OOP in Java and C++)
Algorithm
topics: Growth of function, divide and conquer, solving recurrences
Basic graph algorithms, shortest paths, disjoint sets, MST
Greedy algorithms intro, dynamic programming intro

course_catalog.title: Advanced Algorithm
topics: Design/analysis of efficient algorithms, models of computation
Advanced sorting/searching, algebraic algorithms, graph algorithms
Matching algorithms, Fibonacci heaps, splay trees
MST and shortest paths, network flows, linear programming
Dynamic programming, probabilistic methods, approximation algorithms
Completeness, lower bound theory for parallel computation
Non-polynomial algorithms and satisfiability set construction

course_catalog.title: Database Design
topics: Database concepts; ER/EER modeling; integrity constraints

course_catalog.title: Microprocessor Design & Assembly Language Programming
topics: HW/SW architecture, instruction formats, assembly format and process
Disk geometry, file system and file I/O
Multitasking and virtual memory, memory/bus interfaces, coprocessor

course_catalog.title: Microprocessor Design & Assembly Language Programming Lab
Computer Architecture
topics: Performance and quantitative principles, memory hierarchy
Pipelining, hazards, ILP (dynamic scheduling, branch prediction)
Storage systems, buses, I/O performance, RAID
Computer arithmetic, vector processors, RISC and Intel 80x86 survey

course_catalog.title: Mathematical Analysis for Computer Science
topics: Sums/recurrences, modular arithmetic, basic number theory

course_catalog.title: Theory of Computing
topics: Regular expressions, pumping lemma, non-regular languages
CFGs, normal forms, pushdown automata, non-CFL
Time complexity and classes P, NP, NPC

course_catalog.title: Operating Systems
topics: Concurrency: mutex/semaphores/monitors/message passing; deadlocks; Linux concurrency mechanisms
Memory management: paging/segmentation/virtual memory; Linux/Windows memory management
File management: organization/directories/security; UNIX/Linux VFS; Windows FS

course_catalog.title: Operating Systems Lab
topics: Linux file I/O and system calls

course_catalog.title: Information System Design & Software Engineering
topics: Information systems, analysis & fact-finding (interviews, questionnaires, JAD), prototyping
Design tools (DFD, data dictionary, ER/state diagrams, flowcharts, HIPO, structure charts)
UML (use case, class, sequence, collaboration, state/activity, component/deployment)
Ethical/social/security issues, estimation (COCOMO), scheduling (PERT/CPM, Gantt), cost-benefit
Software quality, process models, requirements, design methods, testing, maintenance, patterns, RUP/UML, project work

course_catalog.title: Computer Networking
topics: OSI model overview, topology, MAC layer services/protocols
IEEE LAN standards; LLC protocols; HDLC; ALOHA
Transport layer and overview of upper layers, email/applications

course_catalog.title: Computer Graphics & Animation Lab
topics: Lab work based on CSE443 (OpenGL, Blender)

course_catalog.title: Artificial Intelligence
topics: Graph search (A*, IDA*), local search (hill climbing, simulated annealing)
Knowledge representation and inference (propositional/first-order logic), Prolog

course_catalog.title: E-Commerce & E-Governance
topics: Electronic commerce foundations, evolution and environment
Technology infrastructure: Internet/WWW protocols, HTML/XML, intranet/extranet
Business strategies: revenue models, usability, marketing, CRM, search positioning
B2B activities: EDI, supply chain, marketplaces/portals
E-commerce software & security, hosting, client/channel/server security
Online payment systems and electronic cash/wallets
Enterprise architecture: frameworks, governance, process and maturity

course_catalog.title: Cloud Computing
topics: Distributed file systems, DSM, sensor networks

course_catalog.title: Graph Theory
topics: Planar graphs and surfaces, directed graphs, flows
Selected topics (dominating sets, perfect graphs, random graphs)

course_catalog.title: Advanced Networking
topics: VoIP, VPNs, network security and QoS

course_catalog.title: Image Processing
topics: Transforms: FFT, DCT, KLT, wavelets/sub-band decomposition
Compression techniques and standards (JPEG, MPEG, H.261, H.263)

course_catalog.title: Web and Internet Programming
topics: PHP basics and OOP in PHP

course_catalog.title: Software Development and Project Management
topics: Software project management foundations, staffing, leadership, conflict management
Maintenance, enterprise/team coordination; cloud and big data awareness

course_catalog.title: Software Development and Project Management Lab
Cryptography & Network Security
topics: Classical cryptography and cryptanalysis; Shannon theory
Public-key crypto: RSA, attacks, factoring; ElGamal, knapsack
Secret sharing, pseudorandom generation, zero-knowledge proofs

course_catalog.title: Management Information System
prerequisites: Successful completion of 110 or more credits
topics: MIS components and integration for control/decision support
Functional applications and impact on society

course_catalog.title: Introduction to Data Mining
topics: Machine learning overview: Bayesian, neural nets, genetic algorithms, ensembles
Advanced topics: PageRank, web/stream mining, sequence mining, event discovery

course_catalog.title: Advanced Java
topics: Intro to J2EE, JSP, RMI, frameworks

course_catalog.title: Advanced Java Lab
topics: Laboratory work based on Advanced Java

course_catalog.title: Parallel and Distributed Computing
topics: Parallel architectures (Flynn taxonomy, GPU, interconnects, coherence)
Parallel algorithm design and performance analysis (Amdahl/Gustafson, isoefficiency)
MPI basics; shared-memory programming with Pthreads (mutex/locks/monitor)
Distributed computing: client/server, middleware, SOA, clusters, load balancing

course_catalog.title: Parallel and Distributed Computing Lab
topics: Laboratory work associated with CSE465 (per elective list)

course_catalog.title: Smart Device App Development
topics: Data storage/sharing, maps and location services

course_catalog.title: Principle of Economics
topics: Demand/supply, elasticity, consumer behavior, utility approaches
Production theory, market structures, cost analysis
Optimization and distribution theory; derivatives in economics
Micro-economics: savings, investment, employment, national income

course_catalog.title: Electrical Circuit Design I
topics: DC sources, resistance/conductance, Ohm’s law, power/energy
Mesh/node analysis, Kirchhoff’s laws, Y-Δ transform
Capacitors, magnetic circuits, inductors, RC/RL DC excitation

course_catalog.title: Electronic Devices and Circuits I
topics: Semiconductors, p-n junction diode (biasing, ideal vs real, load line, equivalent circuits)
Transistor biasing, Darlington pair, AC/DC load line

course_catalog.title: Electronic Devices and Circuits Lab
topics: Practical studies: DC/AC circuits, motors, generators, transformers, starters, rectifiers, transistor amplifier, IC applications, wiring/layout

course_catalog.title: VLSI Design
topics: Layout and λ-based design rules, stick diagrams
Complex CMOS gates, RC estimation, timing, scaling

course_catalog.title: VLSI Design Lab
topics: Associated lab work for VLSI Design (per elective list)

course_catalog.title: Communication Theory
topics: Communication system overview, noise, information theory, channel capacity
Analog/digital comm; AM/SSB/VSB/QAM detection; FM/PM demodulation
Digital modulation (ASK/PSK/FSK) bandwidth, detection, noise performance
System design parameters, channel selection, performance simulation

course_catalog.title: Telecommunication Engineering
topics: Intro to cellular telephony and satellite communication

course_catalog.title: Digital Signal Processing
topics: Intro to speech and image processing

course_catalog.title: Digital Signal Processing Lab
topics: Associated lab work for DSP (per elective list)

course_catalog.title: Intermediate Composition
topics: Composition and grammar support for accuracy

course_catalog.title: Differential and Integral Calculus
topics: Mean value theorems, Taylor expansion, L'Hospital
Partial differentiation; tangents/normals; maxima/minima; curve tracing
Areas/arc length/volumes/surface of revolution; Jacobian; multiple integrals

course_catalog.title: Complex Variables and Transforms (Laplace & Fourier)
topics: Complex numbers, limits/continuity, differentiation, C-R equations, mappings
Complex integration, Cauchy theorems, Taylor/Laurent, residues, contour integration
Laplace transforms (existence, inverse, derivatives, step/periodic functions, DE solving)
Fourier series/transforms and boundary value problems

course_catalog.title: Linear Algebra and Matrices
topics: Matrices: types, algebra, inverse, transformations, rank, canonical forms

course_catalog.title: Introduction to Business and Management
topics: Business concepts and classifications, national/international business

course_catalog.title: Physics I
topics: Mechanics (kinematics, Newton’s laws, energy, momentum, rotation, gravitation)
Heat & thermodynamics (first/second law, kinetic theory, Carnot, entropy)

course_catalog.title: Physics II
topics: Electricity & magnetism (fields, Gauss law, potential, capacitance, current, Ampere/Biot-Savart)
Optics (aberrations, interference, diffraction, polarization) with listed references

course_catalog.title: Physics Lab
topics: Laboratory work based on PHY161 and PHY 1031

course_catalog.title: Engineering Ethics
topics: Ethics and professionalism; moral reasoning; codes of ethics
Engineering as social experimentation; workplace responsibilities
Environmental ethics; global justice; case studies

course_catalog.title: Statistical Methods and Probability
topics: Descriptive statistics, probability, random variables and distributions
Expectation/MGF, joint & marginal distributions, independence, CLT
Sampling methods and survey methods (SRS, stratified, systematic, multistage)
Estimation (MoM, LS, MLE, Bayes), confidence intervals

course_catalog.title: Digital Communication
topics: (Detailed topics not listed in elective table)

course_catalog.title: Advanced Embedded Systems
topics: (Detailed topics provided in course description; ARM Cortex-M3/M4 oriented)

course_catalog.title: Advanced Embedded Systems Lab
topics: Associated lab work for CSE457 (per elective list)

course_catalog.title: Research Methodology
topics: (Listed in semester plan; detailed topics not shown in the captured catalog snippet)

course_catalog.title: Project OR Internship
topics: Capstone project or internship (as per semester 12 plan)
